LAPM.ExampleModels¶

Example linear autonomous pool models.

Classes

TwoPoolsFeedback(alpha_12, alpha_21, u_1, u_2) Two-compartment model with feedback.
TwoPoolsFeedbackSimple(alpha, u_1) Two-compartment model with no feedback.
TwoPoolsNoFeedback(alpha, u_1, u_2) Two-compartment model with no feedback.
class TwoPoolsFeedback(alpha_12, alpha_21, u_1, u_2)[source]¶

Bases: LAPM.LinearAutonomousPoolModel.LinearAutonomousPoolModel

Two-compartment model with feedback.

\[\begin{split}u = \begin{pmatrix} u_1 \\ u_2 \end{pmatrix}, \quad A = \begin{pmatrix} -\lambda_1 & \alpha_{12}\,\lambda_2 \\ \alpha_{21}\,\lambda_1 & -\lambda_2 \end{pmatrix}\end{split}\]
A_cum_dist_func(age=None)¶

Return the cumulative distribution function of the system age.

Parameters:age (nonnegative, optional) – age at which \(F_A\) is to be evaluated, defaults to None: purely symbolic treatment
Returns:cumulative distribution function of PH(\(\bf{\eta}\), \(\bf{A}\)) (evaluated at age)
Return type:SymPy expression or numerical value

See also

PH.cum_dist_func()

A_density(age=None)¶

Return the probability density of the system age.

Parameters:age (nonnegative, optional) – age at which \(f_A\) is to be evaluated, defaults to None: purely symbolic treatment
Returns:probability density of PH(\(\bf{\eta}\), \(\bf{A}\)) (evaluated at age)
Return type:SymPy expression or numerical value

See also

PH.density()

A_expected_value¶

Return the (symbolic) expected value of the system age.

Returns:expected value of PH(\(\bf{\eta}\), \(\bf{A}\))
Return type:SymPy expression or numerical value

See also

PH.expected_value()

A_laplace¶

Return the symbolic Laplacian of the system age.

Returns:Laplace transform of the probability density of PH(\(\bf{\eta}\), \(\bf{A}\))
Return type:SymPy expression

See also

PH.laplace()

A_nth_moment(n)¶

Return the (symbolic) nth moment of the system age.

Parameters:n (positive int) – order of the moment
Returns:nth moment of PH(\(\bf{\eta}\), \(\bf{A}\))
Return type:SymPy expression or numerical value

See also

PH.nth_moment()

A_standard_deviation¶

Return the (symbolic) standard deviation of the system age.

Returns:standard deviation of PH(\(\bf{\eta}\), \(\bf{A}\))
Return type:SymPy expression or numerical value

See also

PH.standard_deviation()

A_variance¶

Return the (symbolic) variance of the system age.

Returns:variance of PH(\(\bf{\eta}\), \(\bf{A}\))
Return type:SymPy expression or numerical value

See also

PH.variance()

T_cum_dist_func(time=None)¶

Return the cumulative distribution function of the transit time.

Parameters:time (nonnegative, optional) – time at which \(F_T\) is to be evaluated, defaults to None: purely symbolic treatment
Returns:cumulative distribution function of the transit time (evaluated at time)
Return type:SymPy expression or numerical value

See also

PH.cum_dist_func()

T_density(time=None)¶

Return the probability density of the transit time.

Parameters:time (nonnegative, optional) – time at which \(f_T\) is to be evaluated, defaults to None: purely symbolic treatment
Returns:probability density of the transit time (evaluated at time)
Return type:SymPy expression or numerical value

See also

PH.density()

T_expected_value¶

Return the (symbolic) expected value of the transit time.

See also

PH.expected_value()

T_laplace¶

Return the symbolic Laplacian of the transit time.

See also

PH.laplace()

T_nth_moment(n)¶

Return the (symbolic) nth moment of the transit time.

Parameters:n (positive int) – order of the moment
Returns:\(\mathbb{E}[T^n]\)
Return type:SymPy expression or numerical value

See also

PH.nth_moment()

T_standard_deviation¶

Return the (symbolic) standard deviation of the transit time.

See also

PH.standard_deviation()

T_variance¶

Return the (symbolic) variance of the transit time.

See also

PH.variance()

a_density(age=None)¶

Return the probability density vector of the compartment ages.

Parameters:age (nonnegative, optional) – age at which \(\bf{f_a}\) is to be evaluated, defaults to None: purely symbolic treatment
Returns:
\(f_a\) (evaluated at age)
\(\bf{f_a}(y) = (\bf{X^\ast})^{-1}\,e^{y\,\bf{A}}\,\bf{u}\)
Return type:SymPy or numerical dx1-matrix
a_expected_value¶

Return the (symbolic) vector of expected values of the compartment ages.

Returns:\(\mathbb{E}[\bf{a}] = -(\bf{X^\ast})^{-1}\,\bf{A}^{-1}\,\bf{x^\ast}\)
Return type:SymPy dx1-matrix
a_nth_moment(n)¶

Return the (symbolic) vector of the nth moments of the compartment ages.

Parameters:n (positive int) – order of the moment
Returns:\(\mathbb{E}[\bf{a}^n] = (-1)^n\,n!\,(\bf{X^\ast})^{-1}\,\bf{A}^{-n}\,\bf{x^\ast}\)
Return type:SymPy or numerical dx1-matrix
a_standard_deviation¶

Return the (symbolic) vector of standard deviations of the compartment ages.

Returns:\(\sigma(\bf{a}) = \sqrt{\sigma^2(\bf{a})}\) component-wise
Return type:SymPy dx1-matrix
a_variance¶

Return the (symbolic) vector of variances of the compartment ages.

Returns:\(\sigma^2(\bf{a}) = \mathbb{E}[\bf{a}^2] - (\mathbb{E}[\bf{a}])^2\) component-wise
Return type:SymPy dx1-matrix
beta¶

Return the initial distribution of the according Markov chain.

Returns:\(\bf{\beta} = \frac{\bf{u}}{\|\bf{u}\|}\)
Return type:SymPy or numerical dx1-matrix
eta¶

Return the initial distribution of the Markov chain according to system age.

Returns:\(\bf{\eta} = \frac{\bf{x^\ast}}{\|\bf{x^\ast}\|}\)
Return type:SymPy or numerical dx1-matrix
r_compartments¶

Return the (symbolic) release vector of the system in steady state.

Returns:\(r_j = z_j * x^\ast_j\)
Return type:SymPy or numerical dx1-matrix

See also

PH.z()
xss()
r_total¶

Return the (symbolic) total system release in steady state.

Returns:\(r = \sum_j r_j\)
Return type:SymPy expression or numerical value

See also

r_compartments()

xss¶

Return the (symbolic) steady state vector.

Returns:\(\bf{x^\ast} = -\bf{A}^{-1}\,\bf{u}\)
Return type:SymPy or numerical dx1-matrix
class TwoPoolsFeedbackSimple(alpha, u_1)[source]¶

Bases: LAPM.LinearAutonomousPoolModel.LinearAutonomousPoolModel

Two-compartment model with no feedback.

\[\begin{split}u = \begin{pmatrix} u_1 \\ 0 \end{pmatrix}, \quad A = \begin{pmatrix} -\lambda_1 & \lambda_2 \\ \alpha\,\lambda_1 & -\lambda_2 \end{pmatrix}\end{split}\]

Inputs and outputs only through compartment 1.

Return the cumulative distribution function of the system age.

class TwoPoolsNoFeedback(alpha, u_1, u_2)[source]¶

Bases: LAPM.LinearAutonomousPoolModel.LinearAutonomousPoolModel

Two-compartment model with no feedback.

\[\begin{split}u = \begin{pmatrix} u_1 \\ u_2 \end{pmatrix}, \quad A = \begin{pmatrix} -\lambda_1 & 0 \\ \alpha\,\lambda_1 & -\lambda_2 \end{pmatrix}\end{split}\]
Qt¶

SymPy matrix – Qt = \(e^{t\,\bf{A}}\) is given

A_cum_dist_func(age=None)¶

Return the cumulative distribution function of the system age.

Parameters:age (nonnegative, optional) – age at which \(F_A\) is to be evaluated, defaults to None: purely symbolic treatment
